documenttitle.text: Red Hat Security Advisory: virt:8.2 and virt-devel:8.2 security and bug fix update

note.text:
An update for the virt:8.2 and virt-devel:8.2 modules is now available for Advanced Virtualization for RHEL 8.2.1.

Red Hat Product Security has rated this update as having a security impact of Moderate. A Common Vulnerability Scoring System (CVSS) base score, which gives a detailed severity rating, is available for each vulnerability from the CVE link(s) in the References section.
note.title: Topic

note.text:
The Advanced Virtualization module provides the user-space component for running virtual machines that use KVM in environments managed by Red Hat products.

Security Fix(es):

* libvirt: double free in qemuAgentGetInterfaces() in qemu_agent.c (CVE-2020-25637)

* QEMU: reachable assertion failure in net_tx_pkt_add_raw_fragment() in hw/net/net_tx_pkt.c (CVE-2020-16092)

For more details about the security issue(s), including the impact, a CVSS score, acknowledgments, and other related information, refer to the CVE page(s) listed in the References section.

Bug Fix(es):

* virtiofsd core dump in KATA Container (BZ#1883869)
note.title: Details

description.text:
For details on how to apply this update, which includes the changes described in this advisory, refer to:

https://access.redhat.com/articles/11258

acknowledgment.Description: Red Hat would like to thank Ziming Zhang (Codesafe Team of Legendsec at Qi'anxin Group) for reporting this issue.
